Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Byrhtnoth18
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as a bargain deal not knowing where we would be sent. It was a wonderful surprise. A new hotel in a terrific location a short walk to Zoo station and therefore quick access to public transport. It is even closer to the bus which goes direct to Tegel airport (109). The rooms are luxurious and we were even given an upgrade to a privilege room. A choice of several different types of pillow! The real plus of this hotel were the amazing staff. They could not have been friendlier or more helpful. My only regret is will we be able to afford it again if not on offer? PS The references to 'historic' building refer to the fact that the hotel is in a restored school dating from the early 1900's but when you walk inside it is very much 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JordanPanov
Reviews.Content: I stayed at H10 Berlin Ku'damm at the begninning of April 2012 and I really enjoyed it. The hotel is well-designed with spacious rooms and the staff was really helpful. I would definately recommend it. The location is also good, next to the Zoo, which offers various connections of the public transport.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel and location, wonderful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Devil-616
Reviews.Content: Me and the wife been there on the 8apr12. We arrived to the Zoo and from there only 4 minute walking to a wonderful hotel. The room was absolutely perfect, the bed was King size, big pillows, Big LCD TV, fancy Bathroom and toilet and a little fridge in the room. The hotel's decoration is beautiful and very very nice. Breakfast was great, alot of food variety and after eating we didn't had to eat nothing until 4pm. The hotel is 10 second walk to the S bahn (subway) and 3 minute walk to a very big Supermarket (Ulrich), on the radius of 2 minute walk you can find C&A, Subway sandwichs, H&M, Salmon Bagels and the entrance to the Kudam shopping street. The hotel is nearly perfect and I recommend it alot !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: allirajane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December when we visited for a 4 day break and were not disappointed. The room was lovely, loved the arty feel to the place, setting it apart from your stock standard hotel. The reception staff bent over backwards to help us, recommending restaurants, the best Christmas markets to go to, and sights to see, even printing off directions how to get there for us. The location was fantastic, we loved Charlottenburg, and very close to public transport. For anyone visiting in December, I would definitely recommend visiting the markets at Schloss Charlottenburg, they were just magical. We loved our trip to Berlin, and a lot of this had to do with the H10 Berlin Ku'damm. This place comes highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish hotel, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Nomad_in_Transit
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend at this beautiful hotel located centrally in Berlin right next to the Kurfürstendamm underground station. It's about 30 minutes away from Tegel airpost on bus 109. Our room was a double room, not big but decorated in a way that made the most of the space available and the only thing I missed was the opportunity to make a cup of tea in the room. Robes and slippers in the bathroom, a well equipped and reasonably priced mini bar and free wi-fi. My husband and I travel much - more for business than pleasure - and the breakfast buffet clearly beats most of the places we've stayed. There's great variety, everything is fresh and the service quick and friendly. Overall the great attention to detail in every aspect provided the perfect setting for a nice break. The staff was friendly and accomodating. We were directed to Bleibtreu Strasse - just a few blocks away - for dinner. When we checked out, the staff automatically offered to store our luggage for later departure. Next time we go to Berlin, we'll book a suite and bring our children (aged 5 and 2).

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: nlay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 for 3 nights in February 2012. The location is convenient - the hotel is right next to the Ku'damm U-Bahn and under 10 minute walk to the Zoo train station (which gets you to/from the airport). The rooms are clean and modern however they don't feel very high quality. The wall to the bathroom is made of frosted glass so you can part see in... Maybe not ideal for a lot of people! The rooms are also rather basic - for instance there's no coffee making facilities in the room and the pillows are rubbish. We had a few problems with the room during our stay (the main one being the toilet continuously flushing) which staff attended to promptly, however they didn't offer to move us to a different room when the problem persisted. All in all, the hotel is fine but I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property shame about service”
Reviews.Author: DannyKaz
Reviews.Content: We booked Deluxe 'Privilege' Room it promised a lots more services than standard deluxe room but service with extras were never delivered. Complained a few times about room, service, privilege lounge and other things but not much was done about it at the time of stay. Only after email was sent we had some refund but experience of the hotel was already ruined. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: korky22
Reviews.Content: Good value clean modern and in the right location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent welcome from friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ParkieM
Reviews.Content: What an entrance. its a bit like an entrance into a lift and yet is actually the entrance to a fabulous hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and the staff were not only courteous, friendly and helpful but their knowledge of the city was fantastic. Thoroughly recommend a stay here. very central for shopping on Ku'damm, overground and subway trains and tourist buses. Very safe and central for bars and restaurants with the zoo a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Very enjoyable weekend in a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at great Location”
Reviews.Author: Riojawikinger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the H10 Berlin during a long weekend with some friends. I booked the hotel based on price and comments made by guests on trip advisor. Overall the hotel was very nice, the lobby was bright and neat, and the rooms were clean and had all the amenities that you need. The staff was very friendly and very professional. I had breakfast one day, and I have to say it was the best Hotel breakfast that I have had anywhere in Europe. I also tried the sauna, and again it was a very good experience. Overall, I can only recommend the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, helpful staff and amazing breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: MCW1001
Reviews.Content: This bright, new hotel was excellent. The staff were incredibly helpful, the room was superb and the breakfast selection was second to none. A short journey from Mitte but better value than more central hotels. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice hotel in the center”
Reviews.Author: Valdimar J
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Berlin with 3 of my friends. We decided we all wanted to be together in a big room. After searching online I came across this hotel which had 4 persons room, the price we got was extremly good for such a nice hotel. The room we got was amazing, it was huge, clean and very comfy bed and sleeping couch. The hotel is very nicely situated at one of the largest shopping streets in Berlin. The hotel itself looks very nice, so from the moment you walk in the hotel you know this is a good place to be. The hotel bar was very nice and served excellent mojitos. For me one of the thing that stood out most was how clean everything was.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at the H10 and was upgraded to a suite. Very nice – thanks a lot guys! Location (10/10): Just 1 minute away from the Kurfuerstendamm, one of the main shopping streets in Berlin. Next door is a Vapiano Restaurant were you can get great Italian food in a very relaxed setting. Next door is also a subway station. About 2 minutes away is a stop for the airport bus. If you walk about 5 minutes you reach Bahnhof Zoo (Zoo station) which is one of the main stations in Berlin. From there you get quickly anywhere. It is also where you can catch the express bus to the airport. Service (10/10): Nothing particular. Fast, friendly and – well – I got an upgrade ;-) Gym (?/10): There is a gym but I haven’t been there. I went for a run which I prefer in a city like Berlin. A good recommendation is to run to Bahnhof Zoo (Zoo station) and from there you can run around the zoo. No need to enter the zoo. A nice run without any cars. Breakfast (?/10): No idea how that is. I had breakfast at a bakery at Kurfuerstendamm. Easy because the hotel is so central. Coffee (10/10): I like good coffee and was very pleased to find a Nespresso machine with some capsules in the room. Free of charge, very nice. Don’t know whether every room has a Nespresso machine or just the suite. Internet Connection (10/10): Free Wifi – what else do you want Room (10/10): Again, since I was upgraded to a suite I have no idea how regular rooms are. The suite however was very nice, very modern, everything was high quality, there was a safe, an alarm clock radio for the iPod or iPhone, everything was clean… I was really excited about this hotel. I can’t tell you anything I didn’t like. And I am usually pretty critical. You will see me more often there ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value and Style - Unprecedented”
Reviews.Author: mgerardlee
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Platinum member and this is the first hotel that I think gives Starwood a run for it's money. The H10 Berlin was amazing not only in the way it was professionally run, but also for the value and style for the money. It felt no less than a W Hotel at 1/4th the cost. I spent three days here and would whole heartedly recommend it to a leisure or business traveler looking for a four star hotel in West Berlin. Internet was free. It worked and it was fast. Staff were friendly, accommodating and gracious. The rooms are spotless and the public areas chic. The hotel is 1 block off of Kudamm (next to the Swisshotel) putting it at ground zero in West Berlin. You can't beat the location if you want a West Berlin address. I can see why it has won the Trip Advisor Awards. It really deserves the awards.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure...”
Reviews.Author: naylajab
Reviews.Content: I have mixed emotions about the H10 Ku'damm having spent the last few days there. Firstly, the background of the booking was that I originally made it for August but couldn't go in the end and totally forgot to cancel it. The hotel were very accommodating as they allowed me to book another time to visit as they had already taken my money. They could have been difficult about this and they weren't which impressed me. The positives of the hotel were: Clean and modern Good location Nice massage Good equipment in the gym Privilege rooms come with access to the Privilege lounge where you can get free tea, coffee, drinks and nibbles. The negatives were: The bed, as previous reviewers have stated, was too hard The pillows weren't great and even though they put a pillow menu by the bed, when we asked for something different they didn't have them (so what is the point of advertising something that you don't have??!) The shower was a complete nightmare - great Grohe rain head shower, but when you have a shower that powerful you aren't going to keep it from going all over the bathroom floor without a door or a platform that is more raised. I had a great massage there, but the massage room is right next to the gym and three people walked in while I was having my massage. It also means that when someone is pounding away on the treadmill it's not as relaxing and quiet as a massage should be. The Privilege Lounge didn't serve and alcoholic drinks apart from beer. Berlin is a great city and I will definitely be returning, but not sure whether I would stay at this hotel again. It could be great, but they have a few issues that need to be sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “H10 Berlin”
Reviews.Author: PETER F
Reviews.Content: A modern, clean, stylish and well run hotel. The H10 Berlin is located in Ku'damm, an area with a wealth of amenities including top designer stores, clubs and old style Berliner beer salons. I would recommend the Alt Berliner Biersalon and especially the Sir Gusche Band who played there on 9th February. They are an old style jazz band that created a wonderful atmosphere; the type you would hope to find in Berlin. I would visit Berlin and stay at the H10 again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noddy6872
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend and both of us really enjoyed it. Staff at reception very friendly. It's walking distance from good shopping and underground stop. Would love to go back

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: zoegnunn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights over New Years and shared a superior suite with my partner and 2 friends. The room was a good size, had lovely large windows and was very clean. The hotel is right next to a train station, and we found it easy to reach everywhere from our location. We heard no noise at all from other rooms, and the only noise from outside was the occasional firework. Only negatives were that the bathroom door was completely transparent (but this wasn't much of a problem with a lounge for people to sit in) and that we had to ask reception twice before we received cups and plates for our kitchen. These were only minor problems though, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, service but not as perfect as it seems”
Reviews.Author: ILYICH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right nearby the shopping Mekka of Berlin (KaDeWe is 5 minutes walk). Shonefeld airport is 30 mins drive. When we arrived all parking spaces were busy (should've mention I needed one when booking). The hotel staff is defenetly helpfull. The hotel itself is perfectly designed, looked very modern and clean. The highest point goes to the restaraunt where we had a dinner! Excellent cuisine and service! Room was good, but 2 things I didn;t like about it: too transparent door to the bathroom (we were there with our kids, so we all needed some privacy in the bathroom). it was TOO cold in the bedroom during our stay. Living room where our children slept was OK, but bedroom was terribly cold. We have left the heaters on maximum temp when arrived, and in the evening it still was COLD (( I was ill so I was suffering. No bathrobes, no slippers were present in the room (should've spent more money in KaDeWe ))_ but it had kitchen with no tableware. This several aspects actually spoiled my great feeling about this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, a bit lacking on details”
Reviews.Author: xristoph
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the H10 hotel over NYE in Berlin for 3 nights. It has a great location, next to a metro (U-Bahn) station, from where one can easily get to all areas of the city. Being a 4-star hotel, it is not a bargain at 150 EUR per night, but quite worth the amount they are charging. The room included a bathtub. The service is good and professional, and overall our stay was very smooth and enjoyable. Our stay was smooth, and they do offer parking - however, it is not free; the charge is EUR 18 per night, something they like to not mention in advance. Given that it is difficult to find parking in Berlin, and outside parking is not much cheaper, we found ourselves without an option. Especially in order to avoid getting the car damaged by rogue fireworks. I felt they need to improve on some details still though, just to mention those here: - Internet passwords are only valid for one device for up to 24 hours. New passwords need to be obtained from the reception. One would think that for that price per night, they could put together a more convenient system. - Minibar charges are as ridiculously expensive as other hotels of the class, so just buy your drinks outside. The parking charges are too high as well. - The choice in pillows is unsatisfactory, seeing as the usual German pillows are super flat; only one neck support pillow was offered, which was the tiny sausage type.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Federhirn
Reviews.Content: A flawless hotel, with flawless service, a diverse breakfast buffet, and not a single cause of complaint or disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: H'10 is very centrally located and next to the U-Bahn station. Very close to Ku'damm and other shopping streets plus the Zoo Station. It is a brand new hotel with contemporary design and comfortable enough rooms. Breakfast Buffet has good variety. Friendly staff. Fast check in and Check out. Free wifi. Fitness quite small, without windows and no music or television, sauna only between 17 - 22. 18 eur for breakfast + 18 eur for one day parking.... Overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Full marks throughout”
Reviews.Author: alan c
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a central location with easy access to all transport and amenities. The grand foyer with its excellent lighting that changes the mood for the time of day is cool and impressive. All the staff are friendly, efficient and genuinely nice and helpful. our room on the seventh floor was spacious, ultra-modern and comfortable - but a hotel guide would have been nice. Highly recommended. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Spumante
Reviews.Content: We stayd 3 nights in H10 Berlin Ku'damm in Junior Suite. The hotel has excellent location. Underground station next door and few steps to the shopping street Ku'damm. Tegel airport is near, about 20 minutes by taxi and costs about 14-16 euros. The room, Junior Suite executive, was large and stylish. Comfortable and quiet. It was located right behind the elevators but they were still silent. Bathroom was clean and simple. Bathropes and slippers available. Espressomachine and quite basic minibar. Our room was on the 4th floor and windows facing to the next buldings windows so no view. Maybe upper floors you can see over the roof. Lobby was modern and the lobby bar offers happy hour at the afternoons. A staff were very polite and helpful, we had feeling to be welcomed. The breakfast was excellent. If there is 8 different kind of cereals and mueslies you can say it is versatile! Me like! Spa. Well. Quite an experience. On the Saturday evening there was about 3-4 couples in the sauna area. There is the steam sauna and the normal sauna. Everyone in the sauna-are has towel along but they didn't mind to cover themselves with them. I mean, there it was kind of unisex sauna for the very open minded people... We felt were unconfortable in there. Sunday night there were a couple who weared swinsuit as we do and it was much more comfortable experience then...Fitness center was small and unfortunately we did't have a time to test that. The Junior Suite excecutive includes access to the Priviledge room. There was complimentary soft-drinks, beer, coffee and tee. A very light light snacks, basically fruits and tapas. A little bit disapointment to us. And a little negative point was that I left my neclase in the room after we had left home. The maid has found it and the hotel very politely offered me to send them to me. I was happy unless they told me that they will charge me 40euros for the shipping fee... A little bit robbery I think for the shipping which actually will costs a couple of euros... :( But IF we travel Berlin next time we will probably try another hotel. There was nothing wrong with this one, but still....I was not that high experience we thought. Oh yes, and about the shopping. The shops and some of the cafes are closed in Sundays. Even the Ku´damms Starbuck were closed! So, the Berlin actually saved a lot of money for us :D

Reviews.Title: “Cool, clean, very Berlin and well located.”
Reviews.Author: JZ100
Reviews.Content: I'd stay again. Funky room with good size. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Filippo555
Reviews.Content: In june my husband and I stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. The room was nice, very quiet (backside of the hotel) and the beds were very good. The front desk personel was very friendly and very helpful. Also excellent breakfast. The weather was super so we have rent a bicycle at the hotel for 2 days, what we really can recommend. If back in Berlin, we certainly chose the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a single traveller”
Reviews.Author: DSkyum
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on top of the Ku'damm U-Bahn station. The staff were very helpful and forthcoming, the quality of the room top notch, and the breakfast buffet was varied. I was travelling single, and I can recommend the H10 for anyone flying solo, whether for business or pleasure. The only thing that detracted from my impression of the hotel, was that you could often hear water running through the pipes when others in the hotel were using their bath facilities. It took a day or so to zone out the sound.

Reviews.Title: “Haribo in mini bar makes one happy!”
Reviews.Author: idilka
Reviews.Content: Nice decoration, perfect location, friendly staff and good price...in addition a nice detail to remind one that you are actually in Germany: haribo in mini bar. Indeed, haribo macht Kinder froh (erwachsene ebenso)!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: Jon K
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the front desk personnel were super super friendly and helpful - like the best service I've received in a long time. We were able to buy tour tickets and rent bicycles directly from the hotel. The lobby and rooms look really good in the pictures, but once you look at the quality of the finishes up close, you see that they cut a lot of corners. The flooring in the rooms and in the fitness center are laminate, not hardwood, and the floor in the fitness center was so warped that I tripped over it. The room shower looked very modern, but it's not at all practical. I'm not a big fan of shower heads that are directly overhead (so you have to bend your head forward to get water on your back), and the shower curb was only about 2 inches high to give it that "infiniti" look, but the drain was not designed well so the shower overflowed in a matter of minutes. They only allowed one wi-fi device password per room, so my wife and I could not both get wi-fi on our phones. The beds had no top sheet, which was a little unusual. And, there was no alarm clock in the room. If back in Berlin, I will probably try a different

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but some downfalls”
Reviews.Author: jinkygenius7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is eye candy. Looks very plush and the service is great. The location is obviously ideal as its a stone throw from the kudam. The negatives for this place are as follows: 1. Well being area closed off. At first the sign said closed till Monday 7th of november then on the 7th a new sign came up saying out of use till the 11th of November. This a consistant habit ? Me thinks so. 2. The rooms are eye catching but cheaply made. I say this as I could hear all the goings on from the room above me from walking to the bathroom, flushing the toilet and then washing their hands. At times it seemed like an elephant was upstairs as well as an Irish dancer. The pipes run down through our room from above and you can here the water trickling down which is so annoying the third fourth and fifth days into the stay. Also the sliding cupboards from the room above vibrated down to our room And you could hear its every movement. The loudest noise came from doors slamming shut from along the corridor and above. As its mainly business users that were there during my stay this started occuring from 6am onwards. Sleep, bang, sleep, bang. On n on n on. 3. This next problem was a sound one too. On the fourth night for the whole night there was a loud sound as of someone was taking a shower for 8 hours. The pipes were so loud that it kept me up the whole night. My fiancée managed to sleep throw it but I never. The next day it was fine in my room but I overheard a gent at check in complaining about this same problem. He was then moved to 623 which was not far from me but by this point it had stopped sounding from my room. Would I go back? Tough one. I paid over the odds for my stay and wouldn't pay that again. My fiancée loved it she thought it was 10/10. I place it at 6.5/10. Hope this helps fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Better stay away”
Reviews.Author: Ulrike011
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights recently and I was totally disappointed in almost every aspect. The most unfriendly staff I ever met. At the entrance you are facing a couple of stairs and there is nobody available or willing to help with the luggage. The shower is a complete disaster. Endless waiting at the coffee bar in the morning.The Spa was" out of order" during my whole stay. Avoid this place and stay somewhere else. There are so many beautiful places in this marvellous city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KM86
Reviews.Content: Easy to find from the ZOO train station, central to the KuDamm area, on a U-bahn line with nearby tourist info centre and on a sightseeing bus tour route. Hotel is BEAUTIFUL, really clean, high end, excellent breakfast which was included in the rate we paid - shop around as we got a brilliant deal through expedia. The screened en-suite door could catch you by surprise on occassion! Room could be improved by having tea/coffee making facilities but due to the room type we booked this facility was not provided. Breakfast was vast and very good, lovely surroundings, although everything was a little serious. If you are looking for character then perhaps not the hotel for you, but for a reasonably priced piece of luxury living for a few nights then would suggest staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect for Berlin Visits.”
Reviews.Author: Postie192
Reviews.Content: We booked H10 Ku'damm as we are regular users of H10 and the location was ideal for our return visit to Berlin after almost 30 years. This newly opened hotel did not dissapoint, it is fresh, clean, reasonably priced and the staff are a credit to H10. It is extremely easy to find, even in a bustling city like Berlin. Just make your way to the Zoo Bahnhoff and walk a few minuites to the hotel, its better than changing to the U Bhan for 1 stop. The staff on reception will help you get the best out of your visit (if required) although having lived in Berlin for 3 years in the late 70's we wanted to test our knowledge and see what had changed. TIP: The Berlin Welcome Card is well worth purchasing if you intend to use public transport a lot and don't neccesarily need a guided bus tour. Lots of discounts too for visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hot,el in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JohnHDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first trip to Berlin in the middle of Oct 11 and was very impressed. I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and had a fairly good idea of what to expect from this hotel The hotel is located in the centre of the Ku'damm area and is right beside the Concorde Hotel and the Swissotel. The hotel is only 3 min walk to the Hard Rock Cafe. It is also literally right beside the Ku'damm subway station The check-in staff were very helpful and friendly and, luckily, spoke perfect english I booked a deluxe room and the room was prefect for one. The bed was comfortable and the temperature in the room was perfect. There was a digital safe, a mini bar and a small flat panel TV in the room. The hotel is quite new and so the items in the room were in almost new condition The bathroom was quite nice and the shower was excellent. The one thing that I did not like about the room was that the bathroom had partially frosted glass instead of a wall. While this didn't affect me at all as I was on my own, I'd imagine that was would be very unsuitable if you were sharing the room with someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ritje
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 day stay in Berlin and were very pleased with our hotel, brand new, with modern design and very friendly staff. We asked for a quiet room on the backside. Breakfast buffet OK, with sparkling wine in the WE. The location is excellent, a 10 min walk to the ZOO Bahnhof with U Bahn, S Bahn , the famous busses 100 and 200 stops, and the Express bus to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel in Ku'damm!”
Reviews.Author: Neox100
Reviews.Content: We booked the H10 hotel in Ku'damm for a four day trip to Berlin, mainly because of the proximity to the main shopping district (Ku'damm). It has to be said, this is one amazing hotel! Very close to local amenities and tube/rail stations. We arrived at the hotel early due to a morning flight. Upon arrival we were advised that our room wasn't available but the receptionist automatically gave us a map and annotated it with interesting places we could visit until our room became available. We set out and did some sightseeing and returned a few hours later. To our delight the receptionist had arranged a free upgrade to one of the luxury suites! Now thats good service! The gym and spa are easy to get to. For you fitness fantastics; x1 multigym, freeweights, x2 technogym treadmills, x1 technogym crosstrainer, x2 technogym bike and a medicine ball/mat area. Hardly used during the evening so it's easy to get a good workout session in before hitting the night scene. Excellent buffet breakfast. Lots of choice including full continental breakfast, booked breakfast (eggs, sausage, bacon etc), cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt, etc. The hotel is perfectly situated in Ku'damm (the main shopping district). Just a two minute walk from many cafe's and bars; including Hard Rock Cafe and many italian restaurants. Approx. 10-15 minutes walk from the gay scene of Berlin. I would highly recommend you take the train to this hotel if you're arriving by airplane... a taxi ride was €40 yet the train was about €3 each! Very frequent and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: The H10 Berlin is a solid 3-star hotel with lots of attributes of a 4 star. Friendly and efficient front staff. Large rooms (for Europe) with modern-chic decoration throughout the hotel. I asked for a quiet room non-smoking room and got one on the backside of the hotel on a non-smoking floor. Big bathroom with tub/shower combination, anti-fog mirrors, bottle shampoo, and (finally) really hot water. Comfortable bed with lots of pillows and comforter/sheet. Large flat screen TV with CNN/Bloomberg/BBC and SkyTV in English. Wireless internet is free (rare in European hotels), though you will need to get a new password from the front desk each day. You will get a small box of candy, and a welcome cocktail if you join the H-10 club which you can do on-line before you get there. As a negative, there is no coffee service in the room, no bottled water, and the rate does not include breakfast. The H-10 is in a great location, two blocks from the Zoo station and next door to an U-bahn station for U1/U9, From Berlin Tegel airport take the 109 bus (get the three day transit pass at the airport) to within two blocks from the hotel. From Berlin Schonfeld airport take the RE train to the Zoo station and walk three blocks (in direction away from the zoo). The hotel is marked H-10 in big red letters on the side above the U-bahn station, but not easily seen from the sidewalk at a distance, so make your map. The doors of the hotel are blacked out and unmarked, but you will figure it out. If you get a good rate, you will be happy you chose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service”
Reviews.Author: Swaldron63
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, excellent location. Very clean rooms, top service in the reception area and bar too. Could not fault anything with this hotel from start of stay to end of stay. The U-Bahn is right outside the hotel entrance, the Ku'damm the main shopping area is a few minutes walk away. Some nice restaurants and bars very close by too and only 5 minutes walk from the Europa Centre, the zoo and the main train station Zoologischer Garten. If you do not fancy the breakfast in the hotel there is a cracking bagel shop called Solomons directly opposite the hotel, you can sit and have your breakfast there, great quality too. However, do not try to cross the road to the bagel shop unless it is at traffic lights, plenty of police standing around both sides of the road, jay walk at your peril!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great”
Reviews.Author: Umkong Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in every respect--price, location, amenities, breakfast, bar, restaurant and staff. It's literally 5 meters to the Kurfustendamm metro entrance, 5 minutes walk to the famous Tiergarten and 8 minutes walk to the KaDeWe, Berlin's most famous department store and shopping district. Because of the metro access, you can get to all the tourist places and restaurants quickly and easily. The breakfast had a huge selection with many items not often found in other hotels (e.g. catering for Asian and Latino clients) and the quality was superb. The rooms are spacious and very modern with wooden floors -I prefer these to carpets. The hotel has a gym, steam room, sitz baths and sauna which is wonderful after a day in meetings. The staff are friendly and very helpful and I will definitely stay in this hotel which was a steal at Euro 105 a night for 2 people including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NycNelson
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel the weekend of the berlion marathon and the papal visit; hotel located at metro stop; convenient for access to major berlin attractions; also, hotel is new so rooms, lobby were in prisitne condition, very clean; AM breakfast was buffet style with typical fare (eggs, sausage, yogurts, breads, cereals); has free internet throughout hotel and access to gym/sauna in basement

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: worldgina
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through trip advisor based on the reviews and the rate was excellent. We stayed here recently (September 2011) and loved it. The staff were very friendly, the location was excellent and we loved the decor of the hotel. Very trendy! The room was spacious and comfortable. Loved having WiFi. The staff recommended us to some great restaurants in walking distance from the hotel. The train station is right next door to the hotel so it was easy to get anywhere in Berlin. Would definitely stay at H10 Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great staff, great location, and very cool!”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in early August this year (2011), and I really can’t stress enough how nice this hotel is, and how much we enjoyed staying here. The rooms are big, spacious, with a very tasteful and trendy modern décor. The décor of the hotel itself is very stylish and the staff were very efficient and friendly. Free Wi-Fi is provided in the rooms, and they are well appointed. The location couldn’t be better, located just south of the Bahnhof Zoo and the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church, so the Ku’Damm is literally on your doorstep. There are so many restaurants and bars nearby, your are simply spoiled for choice, and getting to and from tourists sites around Mitte is easy with the U-Bahn entrance quite literally next door to the hotel (U9 Line - Kurfürstendamm U-Bahn) We didn’t have dinner a the hotel, so not sure what that experience would be like, but breakfast was fantastic, with a huge selection, and the staff were very efficient and friendly. I cannot fault this hotel at all, and would certainly stay here again – in fact, I’d look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lack of attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: firenzesydney
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect right about the Ku'damm U-bahn and not far from the Zoo S-bahn stations. Free open wifi and comfortable beds. The hotel looks much better in photos than it does close up as there is a lack of attention to detail. The airconditioning in the room was noisy and barely cooled the room. The floor in the room is a fake wood/vinyl over concrete. The carpet on the main stairs in the hotel is already starting to show wear and the hotel is still new. This hotel will be ok if you can get it for a good price while it is still new. Otherwise there are plenty of other nicer places to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Incomplete hotel with questionable policies”
Reviews.Author: dieuwer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the H10 Berlin for a short weekend break in September. Although I based my decision to stay at this hotel on previous glowing reviews, with the knowledge I have today I would have not. First of all, I find this hotel not very welcoming. The grey steel outside doors are closed and you will have to find the one that will open to you by standing in front of it, one by one. Secondly, you will need to drag up your suitcase as the reception is at the far back of the entrance, after several stairs. Check in is polite but not more than that. Minimal I would say. Staff is willing to grant 1-night Wifi access. For more than that you have to request it again the next day. Unacceptable behavior for a business hotel. Next up: the room. It's was very small. No desk, no tray to place a suitcase, no radio clock, while the "mini bar" consisted of several sweets displayed on the night stand WITHOUT any price tag (I come to that later). The shower cabin was "missing" a door, soaking the entire bathroom during taking a shower. In short, the room was in need of a makeover. At check out, I was asked if I had anything from the mini bar. *They must mean the "free" snacks!* Displayed as welcome gifts...Not. So, yes I had some of this and was sternly asked to pay. There was no arguing about the missing price tags; I just had to pay. I can tell you this: back home in the US this hotel would loose in a "snack lawsuit". But then again we're in Germany... Overall, I had a disappointing stay and will not be back. Not at ANY H10 for that matter until quality control is taken seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: steveleeds
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to a H10 hotel and have to say the service was A* ... above and beyond anything we have ever experienced Fantastic service from check in staff and indeed the entire hotel team. Great location and only a couple of minutes walk from major train station (Zoo) underground is closer still, with an underground walkway that leads directly to the side of the hotel... ideal if it's raining ! Could not fault the hotel and we are very picky on faults !!! Breakfast choice is vast and of a very high standard Would definately stay there again next time we are in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price/performance ratio!”
Reviews.Author: Knaeppchen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on an online travel agency for only 270 € for two nights. They had excellent reviews everywhere on the net and we were not disappointed. Located near the famous Kurfürstendamm, you are in the middle of Berlin-Charlottenburg. With excellent connections to the city on the stations Kurfürstendamm oder Zoologischer Garten. The rooms are clean and modern and stylish designed. The staff is very professional and helpful. The breakfast is awesome with a very large selection. I do not often get such a good price / performance ratio. Absolutely happy I choosed this one!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and great value”
Reviews.Author: NSSF
Reviews.Content: Great location, 500 meters from the Zoo station and just around the block from Ku'dam. Very nice room - although the Junior suit is more of a large room than a suit. Comfortable bed and nice extras, specifically if you are an H10 club memner (free to join). The staff was extrenly helpful - both reception and all the others. Spotless clean, If you take a "Preveliged room" you get free entrance to thier lounge which is an added bonus of comfort we highly recommend. Would defenetly return!!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently situated and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jctc79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated for transport links, both the airports are well connected to the nearby train station and there are also 2 metro stations close by. I arrived late into Berlin via Tegel and left early via Schonefeld so the hotel was perfect for my rather awkward travel plans. The room was of a decent size whilst everything appears new and it's very comfortable. The fitness centre is rather strange with the gym equipment and the sauna/steam rooms almost in one space. However it was adequate and it's nice to have the facility. Plenty of bars and eateries nearby and of course shops. The hotel was great value for money and would consider staying here again if I was to stay in the Wilmersdorf Ku'damm area.

Reviews.Title: “Best find in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: minimu
Reviews.Content: I stayed for bussiness for 1 night. Location was perfect next to subway stop & 26 min by bus from Tegel. Room was supaciuos, with clean bath tub, hi-speed free Internet and comfy lounge chairs. Ideal for family travel as well,as there are parks and the zoo in the area. Convenient for shopping. There is a very good bagel shop in front of the hotel, and Lidl for necessities. front staff are friendly and helpful. This is the best hotel I stayed in Berlin so far.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite buttoned-up yet...”
Reviews.Author: drlpc
Reviews.Content: I selected this new hotel in the H10 family because I've stayed in their Barcelona/Maritime hotel. This one is well sound-proofed (save for slamming doors) and very chic with its stark interior (although having a 6-foot face of Garbo staring at me for 2 weeks was a bit odd). The staff are very friendly and the breakfast-- an H10 speciality-- fantastic, if slightly dear, particularly if you don't arrange for the B&B option beforehand. The room cleaning was a bit hit-or-miss. One time they forgot to leave soap. Another time they left hand towels for the bath mat. And they don't seem to have changed my bed linens in several days (or else they are pre-rumpling them). But all in all a good value in Ku'damm, which has its share of excellent hotels. They definitely need to fix the lift from the front door, however, as right now everyone must struggle up the 20 steps to the lobby. I've spent part of my time helping mothers with baby prams get up and down.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, modern but with some issues.”
Reviews.Author: bckrSTHLM
Reviews.Content: stayed with a friend for another leisure trip to Berlin. The hotel is stylish, modern and smart. our room was very large on the third floor with all amenities you could want. Free easily accessed wifi as well. The service however show a real minus. The staff is friendly and helpfull but the room missed "do not disturb" signs, bathrobes, clean towels and refilling of the minibar. After several calls on these issues we got everything we needed, but should one need to call for basics? Cleaning was not done any well. The room was not tidy after cleaning im sorry to say. The location in former west Berlin is nice but for my taste to off from the new happening Berlin in the east. All in all the hotel is very nice but with issues as i mentioned. The rate through hotels.com was the best rate i have ever had, so if you look for an inexpensive good place to rest, BOOK IT!

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Hotel with Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: FPFTVP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the H10 Berlin Ku'damm at the end of June/beggining of July and overall was satisfied with the stay. It is a brand new hotel, very well located at the heart of the Ku'damm shopping street with major retailers and a subway station right next door, several bus stops of major bus lines as well as the Zoo Garden Train/Bus Station also within a 5 minute walk. Wi-Fi only in the lobby. The facilities are brand new, including reception, lobby (very nice), elevators and so on. They have just been open for a few months so look for bargains as they're still trying to attract as many new customers as they can. Ask for a room facing back. Service was OK, front desk staff willing to help with instructions, directions and so on. Check in and check out was average. Breakfast is very good, with a large, nice and bright restaurant and several options, including a expresso coffee machine. Room was OK, with brand new appliances and large wardrobe. If you have more than two suitcases then it will be cramped. Bed was very good, A/C worked well except for the first night. What they have to be careful about is maintenance. Even though the hotel is brand new, the materials used require constant maintenance, otherwise in a short time they'll have problems... But overall I recommend this hotel because of price, location and above all being a brand new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and crisp decor, excellent and helpful staff, amazing price for such a quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Couls
Reviews.Content: This place is chic boutique. Decor made me smile as we entered the lobby after wondering what I would be getting for just under £400 for 5 nights. The receptionist seemed to speak several languages and took her time checking us in and supplying lots of useful information. The breakfast was expensive but probably about standard for a 4* at €18 so we ate breakfast at a great local place called Solomon Bagels just opposite. Rooms are clean and modern. Brilliant location in the heart of Berlin off the main shopping street Kurfurstendamm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: danic33
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from 5 days in Berlin and stayed at the H10 Berlin Ku'damm hotel. I had read some of the reviews on trip advisor and went with an open mind. We found the hotel excellent. The staff at the reception where helpful and friendly and everywhere was spotlessly clean. The breakfast is perfectt-everyone is catered for. There was some noise from the nightclub opposite the hotel but if you shut the window you don't notice it. We tried the sauna, solarium and tread mills in the gym which were very nice after walking all day around Berlin! Berlin is an amazing city and we came back home feeling as though there was lots more to see. My Son particulary liked the Berlin Philharmonic building. The concerts start again in September and he is keen to go back and see the Orchestra. If you want to see the RIchstag make sure you book online. We were disappointed we couldn't go into see the dome. The transport system is very good and the hotel is not far from the main train station at Zoological Garden The train from the airport takes you straight there. It's been a great short break and I would recommend both the Hotel and Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Stricken
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate and not knowing what to expect were pleasantly surprised with this new, chic, minimalistic, well located hotel. All mod-cons, cool styling, great breakfast, comfy bed and really tasty cocktails at the bar. It is close to city West for great shopping and interesting specialist shops off the main drag - the Kurfurstendamm. Also very close to the Tiergarten park which is excellent for early morning jogging. Top spot!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in all respects ...”
Reviews.Author: NZ_SandS
Reviews.Content: I know Berlin well so was somewhat reluctant to take up the €100 B&B offer and risk it with a new hotel. So pleased I did. A better location would be hard to find, super friendly accommodating staff (early and late check in / out with a smile), super comfy rooms and a breakfast buffet to beat all others. Don't think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern design, very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Anita7702
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive room on the 7th (top) floor of the hotel. The room had a standard size and modern design; the added value was a limitless access to the "Privilege lounge" on the ground floor offering free Nespresso café, tea, soft drinks, beers, fruits and snacks/sandwiches, furthermore internet and print machine 0/24. I am sure we could not actually consume as much as the price difference between a normal room and the executive room, but it was very convenient. Huge appreciation: after we checked out at noon, the desk clerk extended our access to the lounge until late afternoon. Summary Pros: location, design, cleanliness, staff, comfy bed, pillow choice, large variety of breakfast buffet, sauna Cons: breakfast is little overpriced, there are appr. 20 stairs from the entrance to the reception area and you have to climb up with your luggage (there is an elevator for disabled people but was out of order during our stay)

Reviews.Title: “This H10 Has Things to Learn”
Reviews.Author: PTV
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel to Berlin and it needs to learn a few lessons quickly. First, the hotel is pretty. European chic. Modern looking, a little stark, not cozy. It is very clean though. All of the staff is pleasant except for the bartender who had a major issue understanding English and was rude. I found this a problem considering that this hotel will be catering to an international crowd. I would assume mostly business travelers. The location of the hotel is good for seeing sites and is near the metro lines for transportation. The downsides...How does a hotel not have clocks in the rooms? This is a city hotel where business travelers will be staying. Business people need to know time. This hotel is not on a deserted beach. The bedding is awful. No top sheet. Two half comforters are on top of the bed and no matter which way you turn them only part of your body is covered. Nice trendy idea, but it does NOT work well. The dinner menu for room service is very limited. Would I stay here again, maybe it was not awful, but I would look into other hotels in the area first.

Reviews.Title: “new and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: osty6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son for a night. The location is exceptional. Free parking in front of hotel. Free internet. Good and large room but no frills..... not even a bottle of water in the room. The bathrooms were clean and had all the soap,gels etc etc. The only problem was the front desk which took too long to check-in. Three people standing there but not efficient people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: Located just off Ku'damm adjacent to the Concorde Hotel and Swissotel, it's really hard to beat this location. The hotel is brand new and you can easily tell by looking at the rooms. Everything seems to be nice and tidy but it doesn't strike me as luxurious. Practical yes, luxurious not really. The reason I decided to stay at this hotel was the great stay I had at H10 Marina Barcelona. This has not come close to the same standard offered in Barcelona. Price range is just about right plus the added value of free Internet which is always expected and nice to have. A lot of people complain about WiFi prices in Berlin, I don't have that issue when staying at most hotels because of my membership status. So for those who don't hold status but want free Internet, this is a good place for that. The building from outside isn't really all that appealing and worst of all are the entrance doors. They are not marked, not labelled, not glass or see through and have no indication of them being doors. If you didn't know that a door should be there instead of the great grey block, the door won't open and you wouldn't find your way in. I think that needs to be fixed. The bar area is nice and all but is way too open for anyone. Some privacy is normally nice to have. Just facing the hotel is one of the loudest teenager clubs in town, lots of youngsters making so much noises, drunk across the street all night long. Do NOT get a room facing the main street, ask for a room facing the backyard. Either the staff never wanted me to stay longer at the hotel or the reservation system on their website in addition to almost every single online agencies were going haywire that day. I had booked the hotel last minute before leaving to Berlin for 2 nights, didn't know how long I was going to stay. After arriving in Berlin I realised the need for staying an extra night and consulted the front desk who assured me they are fully booked and they have been like this for the entire week (which doesn't add up because I just made the booking for those 2 nights). After I told them to check it online they found rooms available and after checking with their manager the answer was that they are fully booked period. Not a big problem for me because I can always just jump across to any of the chains I am a member of and I know I will have a room available. Surely enough, Crowne Plaza honoured me with a great room and great service after knowing of the incident. For fun, I decided to check the website for rooms and they still had rooms available, along with a bunch of other online travel agencies that I normally use for hotel bookings without glitches whatsoever. Bottom line, is it a nice hotel? Yes. Value for money? I get better service and nicer rooms for the same and lesser prices (memberships, corporate deals we have, etc..) Would I consider it a gem? No. Will I recommend it to other people and friends? Yes if they are sure of their dates (but then again, there's no guarantee their booking will be honoured since I could've just reserved it online and still get told there are no rooms and be told to leave and find somewhere else to stay). So, No! Will I ever return there? To H10 hotels elsewhere, yes. H10 in Berlin, most likely not.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: sugar_heart
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days last week. This hotel has only been opened recently and you can definitely tell as there is still a few loose ends and work going on in certain areas. The hotel itself is beautiful and staff are very friendly and try and do all they can to make your stay pleasant. Our room was very nice my only complaints are that the wooden floor wasn't cleaned the whole 5 days we were there so there was a lot of dust, Room windows didn't open which was very annoying especially when it was 23 degrees outside and also we were disappointed that we didn't have any tea/coffee facilities for the amount we had paid for the room. Breakfast is €18 pp but there is a lot of café's and places around to get breakfast and lunch so we only used this facility once. Wifi is free which is a great bonus & the spa area is ok but not quite as good as the website suggested. The hotel has a perfect location for all the tourist attractions and is right off the Kurfürstendamm. The train station is a 5 minute walk away with the Zoo just across from that plus many more things around within easy walking distance. For that reason we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with nice rooms and good service”
Reviews.Author: one_A
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel with family. Its brand new, and everything is exceptionally clean and beautiful lobby and also the rooms. loved the design. Staff was friendly. Had booked two rooms but Hotels.com messed up our reservations, so we got two rooms on different floors. Had a chat with the staff, and the next day our rooms were changed. The new rooms were really wonderful with one having a king size bed (we had booked both with queen size beds). We asked for a baby crib for the first night because of booking mess and the small beds, and we did not have to pay extra for that. Parkering in the area is also easy, and there is a parking plaza right across the street (13 euro pr. night).

HotelInfo.Name: H10 Berlin Ku'damm
HotelInfo.Address: Joachimstaler Strasse 31-32, 10719 Berlin, Germany
